alert.note: Alert for Camden; Pasquotank; Perquimans (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Camden, Pasquotank, northwestern Perquimans and northwestern Currituck Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from South Mills to near Morgans Corner to 6 miles northeast of Belvidere. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... South Mills and Morgans Corner around 230 PM EDT. Chapanoke around 250 PM EDT. Elizabeth City and Moyock around 255 PM EDT. Camden around 300 PM EDT. Whitehall Shores around 305 PM EDT. Elizabeth City State University and Nixonton around 310 PM EDT. Currituck, Weeksville, Shiloh and Indiantown around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Horseshoe, Pierceville, Peach, Parkville, Tar Corner, Nicanor, Gregory, Sharon, Pasquotank and Spences Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
